p: Phragmanthera capitata is a mistletoe plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It is a mandatory hemiparasite that attaches and enters the stems and branches of its host tree through a haustorium [ 1, 2]. This plant is widely distributed in Cameroon and in some other African countries. It is characterized by yellow flowers with red apex [ 3]. It can grow on various plants, including Persea americana, Psidium guajava, Citrus sinensis, Podocarpus mannii, Hevea brasiliensis, Spondias mangifera, Garcinia kola, Manniophyton fulvum, Theobroma cacao, and Citrus spp. [ 4]. In Cameroon, leaf, stem, or whole plant is claimed to cure up to 38 diseases, including infectious diseases, nerve pain, cancers, and cardiac disorders, but mostly used to cure hypertension and diabetes [ 5, 6].
